page.title: 05GARSIDE SAND QUARRY
page.content: Garside Sand Quarry is situated at the end of Grovebury Road Industrial Estate. The quarry has been operating for one hundred years. It has been owned by English China Clay since 1978. The quarry produces 350,000 tones of constuction sand per year. The sand is used in the manufactor of concrete and roof tiles. The 40,000 square metre site is owned by the Church who also recieve a royalty of Â£0.47 per tonne. The top soil and clay are removed, then the sand is extracted by a dredger from below the water level. The sand and water is piped to machinery which removes the dirt. The water is then removed by a machine called a hydroclone which uses centrifugal force. The sand is then loaded into lorries using a conveyor belt and hopper.
